title: Vivienne Malone-Mayes
summary: Vivienne Lucille Malone-Mayes (February 10, 1932 â€“ June 9, 1995) was an American mathematician and professor. Malone-Mayes studied properties of functions, as well as methods of teaching mathematics.[1] She was the fifth African-American woman to gain a PhD in mathematics in the United States, and the first African-American member of the faculty of Baylor University.
